reviews.text: I stayed here for a library conference last year and I must say this is probably one best hotel I have ever stayed. Their standard room, looks like a miniature suite. Everything is very plush and comfortable. Fantastic service and close by to nearby restaurants/shops.
reviews.title: Stay in Style

likes.disliked: — I was charge $9 for a sandwich.

reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference in 2005. Overall, I enjoyed the experience. The lobby is fantastic, and you can sit in the lobby at the bar and have a drink. It is laid out very nicely. There is a Starbucks in the lobby also, which is terrific. The gym is good enough, the equipment was fine. I did not use the pool. We could walk to restaurants outside which was helpful. My first room was small, a wierd corner room, but the hotel was booked. The next day they graciously moved me to a very large room with a wall of windows. I was impressed. I have no complaints about this hotel and enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: good experience

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night on January 1, 2008. I had client meetings in Central DC and on Capitol Hill the next day. I chose to stay at this hotel due to its very close proximity to National Airport and the Washington metro system. The hotel provides complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — very nicely designed room floorplan and tasteful decor
likes.disliked: — nothing comes to mind

reviews.title: Here is the scoop!
reviews.text: The hotel was booked through Travelocity as a "Winter Getaway" special at a cost of $89 plus tax. This rate included a free breakfast - normally an item that costs $18.99 plus gratuity. Winter room rates are generally $289/night plus tax, and up.
Check-in and check-out was handled promptly and efficiently. Desk and concierge staff were courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Hyatt

likes.liked: — The hotel was not too close to the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HIGHLIGHTS: Location, great staff, friendly check-in, rewards program, modern room design, fast elevators, availability of services, flat screen televisions, plenty of electrical outlets, upgraded bedding, cleanliness (rooms and halls), good wireless connection, value, flight check-in/boarding pass retrieval.
reviews.title: Great Hotel + Great Price = Excellent Weekend

likes.liked: — Value, style, Hyatt service,free airport/metro shuttle.
likes.disliked: — Staff who did not speak English.

reviews.text: AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT: Lack of English speaking staff, 1+ mile from Metro stop.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — no coffee maker in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OVERALL: Crystal City is one of the D.C. area gems. This hotel is no exception to that rule and on a weekend tourists run Crystal City.
reviews.title: Great Luxury Value

likes.disliked: — needed shuttle to Metro

reviews.text: There was a reunion happening over the two days we were there. Not only were those people having a great time, but also crowd control was in effect and the staff did a great job of moving people through the hotel registration, valet, and common areas. We did not come for the reunion but rather extended our stay from another Hyatt (the one near Capitol Hill). I found this a far superior room and overall deal (nearly $100 less/night) as opposed to Capitol Hill, and although it is a long walk to the nearest Metro station, you pass by many little shops, restaurants and safe public areas, which make a leisurely Saturday stroll advantageous.
reviews.title: Hyatt Crystal City

likes.disliked: — The distance from the Metro Station

reviews.text: I would not necessarily recommend this hotel location to a business traveler although it has ample in-room comforts and the T-Moble Hot Spot Internet. I thought the views were great and the hotel was very quiet, well kept, and responsive. Again, it is worth it to sign up for the Hyatt Gold Passport, to expedite your reservation process and ensure check-in runs smoothly.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - bit far from the Metro

likes.disliked: — Distance from the Metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here as an overnighter for the airport - which worked out great. The room was very modern with glass doors on the closet and bathroom (which had no lock - which was odd).
reviews.title: Good accomodations, a bit far from Metro

likes.disliked: — Proximity to Metro

reviews.text: Free breakfast buffet with a AAA reservation which was nice. There was a Redskins game and lots of fans staying at this hotel, but it was quiet in the room and we never had to wait in line for anything.
reviews.title: Quiet Airport Location

likes.disliked: — Location a little away from the Metro had to use the shuttle or walk 15min

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the downside, there's no self-parking, so you are stuck having to valet your vehicle each time - and if you want to get to the Metro by foot - it's a bit of a jaunt.
reviews.title: Good value!

likes.liked: — The comfortable bed after a long day of walking!
likes.disliked: — the dust...they really need to dust their rooms!

reviews.text: I probably wouldn't stay here if I were spending time to "see" D.C. - but for the airport it was perfect.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did stay for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Great location - Alright hotel

reviews.text: this hotel isn't as bad as all the other reviews made it out to be. it was very clean and the staffs were very helpful and courteous. shuttles every 30 mins to the airport and metro station. the only downside is that it is somewhat hidden from all the stores and restaurants (about 15 min hike). speaking of restaurants, you must try Ted's Montana Grill (the buffalo bison dishes are incredibly tasty and healthier than traditional red meats) do not eat at the hotel restaurant on the top floor unless you have money to burn (way way way overpriced for what looked like marginal food). the fitness center is very well equipped!
reviews.title: very nice hyatt
Hyatt worth it
reviews.text: I have stayed in so many hotels in the DC area...and I love the Hyatt. Yes, it can get pricey to get a room, but it is worth it! The staff is GREAT, LOVE the shuttle, and it is within walking distance to so many wonderful things. Also, check out the gym (nice machines!).
The food and drinks are WAY overpriced, though, so make sure to walk to those wonderful things to eat. And don't bring your car. They charge an arm and a leg to park (even for DC).
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

likes.liked: — Size, decor and cleanliness of room
likes.disliked: — Dim lighting, location in office park type enviromt

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my expectations, probably because some reviewers here stayed in rooms prior to completion of renovations. The renovated rooms are sleekly decorated, with oversized shower and modern, but comfortable, furniture/decor.
reviews.title: great service

reviews.text: THE GOOD:
reviews.title: Nice hotel

likes.disliked: — The distant walk to the Crystal City Metro Station

reviews.text: First class all the way. Great service from Bellboys, Front Desk, Breakfast Servers, Concierge, and Shuttle drivers. Clean rooms, comfy beds. $84 winter rate was a great deal and much cheaper than staying in the city. It is at the end of hotel row, so it is a 15 minute walk to restaurants and shuttle, but that would be my only gripe. Fantastic American breakfast buffet. Expensive at $17, but you can book as a winter deal and get breakfast included if you prepay. All the food was expensive here so we chose to dine outside other than breakfast. Bellboys gave a full spiel about the hotel, the emergency exits, the restuarants, etc. Housekeeping cleaned our room as we ate since we were travelling with a small child. I read some negative reviews of this place and honestly I am disgusted with the level of service in the US. 90% of the time, the service sucks no matter where you go. Well, not here. It was very nice to be treated as a guest of the hotel. The shuttle runs every 20 min to the airport and every 15 min to the Metro stop so it is convenient if you don't like to walk. No bathtubs in our room though, only an oversized shower. Wireless internet in each room for $9.95 a day. Also, lots of good restaurants nearby, especially CHIPOTLE!! IF you haven't tried Chipotle, you are missing out., 1 lb Burritos, custom made with all homemade salsas and beans. The meats are naturally raised and the service is friendly. Not what you would expect from a fast casual place. Just wanted to give a shout out to Chipotle, the best burritos in the world!!
reviews.title: Great Service

likes.disliked: — expensive food

reviews.title: LOVED this Hyatt
reviews.text: I got a great deal on hotwire for the Hyatt. The staff was so friendly and the room was fantastic. It was so clean, modern, and the bed was so comfortable. It was a very large room. Too bad I only was there for one night. I wish I could have stayed there during my entire visit to DC. The staff called shortly after check in to make sure everything was to my liking. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. I will def. stay here again!

I spent 3 nights at the Hyatt attending an on-site conference. There were some definite positives: the front desk was cheerful and (sometimes) helpful, and the standard room was spacious and clean, with exceptionally comfortable beds. The rooms were made up quickly every morning. Problems: food availability, quality, and service were VERY uneven. Breakfasts and lunches in the informal dining room were pretty good, but the service was sometimes unbelievably slow. One evening we sprang for dinner at their rooftop restaurant - I don't recommend this. The prices are astronomical and the food mediocre - and I'm not a foodie. Go up for a drink, though, so you can enjoy the spectacular view. One evening we had light food in the lobby bar - greasy, not very hot, and again, incedibly slow. There are restaurants about 3 blocks from the hotel, but its location is not the most convenient for getting out and wandering around.
reviews.title: Only Fair

likes.disliked: — Food service

reviews.text: Coffee was another problem - we didn't discover until the last night that in order to have a coffee pot in our room, we had to ask for it at the front desk. I don't really have a problem with that except that it would have been nice if someone had mentioned it at check-in. There's a Starbucks in the lobby, but it closes in the late afternoon, and the ordinary restaurant closes after lunch.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms, good service
Well Run, Smart Looking Hotel, Rooms Can Be Noisy
reviews.text: We paid for an in-room movie our last night there - nice flat-screen tv, but the movie simply cut off 2/3 of the way through. The cheerful instructions from the front desk about what to do resulted in our being charged a second time for the movie and still not being able to finish it (they did remove the charge from the bill).

My husband and I stayed 5 nights last week at the Hyatt Regency Crystal City while I attended a conference at the hotel. We enjoyed our stay. When we checked in, we asked for one of the renovated rooms and were told that all of the room renovations have been completed. We also asked for a bathroom with a bath tub, so we were given the room at the end of the hall of the 6th floor, which I think was larger than most rooms.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay.

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping was slow

reviews.text: During our stay, we ate lunch twice at the Cinnabar restaurant. They have a nice lunch buffet with made-to-order stir fry for $16. We also ate dinner at the Chesapeake Grill and the Lobbibar. The food was good, but somewhat expensive.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Hyatt

likes.disliked: — slow housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all very nice at check-in and check-out. The concierge booked a Washington DC twilight bus tour for us which picked us up at the hotel. We also made use of the hotel's free airport shuttle to Reagan National and the shuttle to the Metro stop at Crystal City.
reviews.title: Wouldn't be my choice

likes.liked: — friendly staff and taxi cabs always available
likes.disliked: — air vent blowing directly on me

reviews.text: There were only a couple things we did not like about the hotel. The TV did make a loud, annoying sound when it was turned on and off, and the housekeeping service seemed slow. One day our room was skipped entirely by housekeeping.
reviews.title: Really nice rooms

likes.disliked: — Not much available in the immediate area

reviews.text: The hotel has a beautiful atrium and three of the six elevators are glass-enclosed. Overall, it is a lovely hotel, but a little bit on the expensive side for us.
reviews.title: Nice

likes.disliked: — service

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while in the DC area for a business trip in early June. Although my meetings were in central DC, I was uncomfortable billing my company for the $450 - 500 room rates charged by many hotels in the District, so I chose the Hyatt Regency Crystal City.
reviews.title: Great value for DC

reviews.text: When I last stayed here in 2004, it was getting tired and in need of sprucing up, so I was pleasantly surprised to find the rooms had been completely renovated in 2006.
reviews.title: Very Nicely Renovated - Good Bargain if Booked at Discount

likes.liked: — Room Decor, Room Service, Convenient Check-In/Check-Out
likes.disliked: — Outlet placement; Noise; Dirty spare blanket

reviews.text: The rooms are now fresh and contemporary without being so avant-garde that you need instructions to figure out how to turn on the lights or flush the toilet.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hyatt

likes.disliked: — The water pressure in the shower was terrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was polite and responsive and had a bathrobe delivered to my room within minutes of my request.
reviews.title: Great, Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Parking fee, internet service fee.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rate -- especially with a AAA discount -- was quite attractive and the savings more than made up for the (minor) inconvenience of having to take a shuttle bus to the Crystal City Metro station. The AAA rate also included a FULL breakfast buffet, which was a nice perk.
reviews.title: Good for the price with some issues

likes.liked: — Freshly redone rooms, super beds, good weekend price
likes.disliked: — Strange boutiquish and badly thought room designs and decors

reviews.text: We flew into Ronald Reagan Airport which was practically next door. They offer shuttle service to and from which was great. It's also just a few short blocks away from the metro and a large shopping center with lots of great places to eat. The area seemed very safe to me; there were single women out walking their dogs at night and the whole place was very laid back.
reviews.title: Loved the Hyatt

likes.liked: — I loved the room, convenience of the shuttle, and the pool
likes.disliked: — I booked the room at the right time as with the normal price I could never have afforded it.

reviews.text: The next time we're in DC, we'll probably stay here again, especially if they've remodeled.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but......

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights July 17 to 19. Loved it. Flew into DC and was picked up by a shuttle at the airport without any fuss. After checking in went to the room. The room was really nice. During out stay used the shuttle all the time to go to the Metro. Found a few placed to eat within walking distance to the hotel.
reviews.title: Stay here every time I got to DC

reviews.text: The pool felt very nice to use after a long day of walking.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE

likes.disliked: — The fact they let my kids and wife sit on the curb without helping with the bags.
